word_mean: 验尸，检验：在验尸官、医务检察官或陪审团对死亡情况作出判断前所进行的法定调查

sentence.Network_en: The inquest will bring in a verdict of suicide.
sentence.Network_cn: 这次审讯将得出自杀的结论。

sentence.Network_en: The inquest into their deaths opened yesterday in Enniskillen.
sentence.Network_cn: 对他们死因的讯问昨天在恩尼斯基林进行。

sentence.Network_en: An inquest was held to discover the cause of death.
sentence.Network_cn: 对死亡原因进行了调查。

Jurors in a British inquest are tracing Princess Diana ' s last moments ., 英国的法官正在追寻戴安娜王妃的最后一刻.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English from Old French enqueste, based on Latin inquirere (see enquire)

entry.def: When an inquest is held, a public official hears evidence about someone's death in order to find out the cause.

example.ex: The inquest into their deaths opened yesterday in Enniskillen.
example.tran: 对他们死因的讯问昨天在恩尼斯基林进行。

entry.def: You can refer to an investigation by the people involved into the causes of a defeat or failure as an inquest .

example.ex: His plea came last night as party chiefs held an inquest into the election disaster.
example.tran: 昨晚政党领袖就选举惨败原因进行调查时,他提出了申辩。

means.word_mean: 1. an inquiry into the cause of an unexpected death

stems_affixes.word_buile: question问题;询问+aire表名词或形容词→n.调查表, 问卷 adj.质问的
con全部+quest寻求,询问→全部寻求到→征服
in进入+quest寻求,询问→问进去→审问
quest寻求,询问→n.探寻,探求;寻求,追求
quest寻求,询问+ion表名词→n.问题;询问 v.询问;怀疑,对…表示疑问
question问题;询问+aire表名词或形容词→n.调查表, 问卷 adj.质问的
re再+quest寻求,询问→在寻求→请求
quest寻求,询问+ion表名词→n.问题;询问 v.询问;怀疑,对…表示疑问

sentences.en: There had to be an inquest on his sudden death.
sentences.cn: 必须对他的突然死亡进行调查。
